Package com.example.breadheadsinventorymanager

Class FirestoreInteract

java.lang.Object
com.example.breadheadsinventorymanager.FirestoreInteract
public class FirestoreInteract extends Object
Class to interact with Firestore. Keeps track of the database and collections, and both sends and retrieves data when necessary.
See Also:
  • FirestorePuttable

    • FirestoreInteract

      public FirestoreInteract()
      Initialize firestore database using defaults. Adapted from lab 5 instructions.

  • Method Details

    • uploadImages

      public void uploadImages(Map<String,android.net.Uri> imageMap, android.view.View view)
      Uploads images that are provided with a reference path to its prospective location on firebase storage
      Parameters:
      imageMap - : maps image paths to the Uri image resource
      view - : the current view to display upload failure/success messages

    • putItem

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> putItem(Item obj)
      Attempts to put the given object into the items collection on Firestore.
      Parameters:
      obj - The object to put into the collection.
      Returns:
      The update task

    • putTag

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> putTag(Tag tag)
      Attempts to put the given Tag into the tags collection on Firestore.
      Parameters:
      tag - The Tag to put into the collection.
      Returns:
      The update task

    • populateWithItems

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot> populateWithItems(ArrayList<Item> list)
      Task to populate a given ArrayList with the contents of the Items collection. Must return as a task because of inherent delays in accessing Firestore. Execution is asynchronous so we must listen for the data to be available!
      Parameters:
      list - ArrayList of Items (probably an ItemList) to place retrieved Items into
      Returns:
      a Task; use .addOnSuccessListener() to run code after data retrieval

    • populateWithTags

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<com.google.firebase.firestore.QuerySnapshot> populateWithTags(TagList list)

    • deleteItem

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteItem(String id)
      Task to delete the item from the items collection with the specified ID
      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the item to delete
      Returns:
      The task; use .addOnSuccessListener() to do something after deletion

    • deleteItem

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteItem(FirestorePuttable obj)
      Task to delete an item from Firestore item collection
      Parameters:
      obj - The FirestorePuttable object representing the item to delete.
      Returns:
      A Firestore deletion task. Use .addOnSuccessListener() to handle success.

    • deleteTag

      public com.google.android.gms.tasks.Task<Void> deleteTag(String id)

      Parameters:
      id - The ID of the tag to delete
      Returns:
      The task; use .addOnSuccessListener() to do something after deletion
